page.title: 01Lammermuirs Dip Slope
page.content: South facing, gently sloping dip slope of the lammermuir hill. Most of the land is cultivated either under cereals or grass including that shown as rough grazing on the 1:50,000 first series O.S. The area also includes some sizable (15-20 h.a.9 commercial conifer plantations,there are the settlements of size but there seem to be four farm units, two having typical rows of farm cottages, some modernised and improved. Those at Buterdean are more substantial than those at Quixwood and still retain their own garden plots. The farms themselves are a mixture of modern sheetcadded units and run down (19 buildings) A well is shown at Butterdeam.
